On this day in 1953, the US formally ended overt conflict in the Korean War. 66 years later, we continue to honor and praise the brave and selfless service of the 5.3 million Americans who served and the roughly 55,000 who gave the last full measure.  https://www.army.mil/koreanwar/

The Mueller hearings today highlighted only one thing: The Majority Party is going into the August District Work Period without a single, tangible accomplishment - not on immigration, not on healthcare, not even on transportation. CAN WE PLEASE GET BACK TO WORK???

Privileged to join Scott Shewell and others of Safe Harbour Inc. in Carlisle, a non-profit group that’s working to end homelessness in our region. We discussed a variety of issues and how to more effectively partner and resolve this pressing problem. Thanks for taking the time! pic.twitter.com/Et7NcVBuOW

Great to see constituents from AgChoice Farm Credit, an agricultural credit association serving 52 counties across the Commonwealth. They help our farmers grow their crops, AND their businesses. I appreciate – as always – the thoughtful discussion! pic.twitter.com/eS2LFE5Fx2

Please join me for a town hall in Hummelstown on Tuesday, July 30 at the Hummelstown Fire Company, 249 E Main St, Hummelstown, PA from 6 to 7:30 p.m. Only residents of the 10th Congressional District may attend. RSVP and photo ID are required.  https://perry.house.gov/town-hall/

Just learned of the passing of Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens at the age of 99. Justice Stevens honorably served our Nation for decades, and my heart goes out to his family and loved ones during this difficult time. Godspeed, Sir.

We need free and fair trade. The USMCA is a great start and a strategic win for the American worker. We have the best workforce in the world; if given a fair opportunity, we’ll always win. pic.twitter.com/hV1syExMxX
We must pass the USMCA to bolster quality, family-sustaining jobs throughout our Commonwealth and our Nation. USMCA is a win for the American worker. #USMCAnow pic.twitter.com/FSJrGUrUN8

It’s been more than 25 years since NAFTA was enacted - before the revolution of e-commerce & the rapid rise of globalization. Our antiquated laws are holding back our economy. We need to modernize our laws. #USMCAnow pic.twitter.com/0bPR8wM2Vn
